message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! It's a one-of-a-kind item that I think you'll love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $250.
Thanks for the offer, Alice! I'm interested, but $250 is a bit steep for me. I'm willing to pay $100 for the product. What do you think?

I understand that $250 is a bit out of your budget, Bob. However, I was thinking more along the lines of $180. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit on this sale. What do you think?
Alice, I appreciate you meeting me halfway, but $180 is still a bit too high for me.  I'm willing to go up to $150.  Let's make this deal happen!

I see you're willing to go up to $150, Bob. I appreciate your enthusiasm for the product! However, I've got to make a profit, so I'm willing to meet you at $170. It's a bit more than my initial offer, but I think it's a fair compromise. What do you think?
Alice, I appreciate your flexibility, but $170 is still a bit higher than my budget. I'm willing to pay $160 for the product. This is my final offer.  Let's make this happen!

I understand you're trying to get the best deal, Bob. However, I'm not willing to go below $175. I think the product's value is worth more than that. I'm willing to give you a slight discount, but I need to make a decent profit. How about we meet at $165?
Alice, I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $165 is still above my limit.  I'm willing to pay $160, my final offer.  Let's make this happen!

I understand you're trying to get the best deal, Bob, but I'm not willing to sell it to you for $160. I'm willing to make one last offer: $170, and that's as low as I can go. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to consider other options.
